org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket

Class ExtensionWebSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionAdaptor
      • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.ExtensionWebSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArrangeableProxyListener, Extension, SessionChangedListener, PersistentConnectionListener, SiteMapListener

    public class ExtensionWebSocket
extends ExtensionAdaptor
implements PersistentConnectionListener, SessionChangedListener, SiteMapListener
    The WebSockets-extension takes over after the HTTP based WebSockets handshake is finished.
    Author:
    Robert Koch

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Extension

        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • hook

        public void hook(ExtensionHook extensionHook)
        This method interweaves the WebSocket extension with the rest of ZAP.

        It does the following things:

        • listens to new WebSocket connections
        • installs itself as session listener in order to react on session changes
        • adds a WebSocket tab to the status panel (information window containing e.g.: the History tab)
        • adds a WebSocket specific options panel
        • sets up context menu for WebSockets panel with 'Break' & 'Exclude'

        Specified by:
        hook in interface Extension
        Overrides:
        hook in class ExtensionAdaptor

      • addWebSocketFilter

        public void addWebSocketFilter(WebSocketFilter filter)
        Add another WebSocket specific filter instance. Listens also to normal HTTP communication.
        Parameters:
        filter - Instance receives payloads and is able to change it.

      • getArrangeableListenerOrder

        public int getArrangeableListenerOrder()
        Description copied from interface: ArrangeableProxyListener
        Gets the order of when this listener should be notified.

        The listeners are ordered in a natural order, the greater the order the later it will be notified.

        Note: If two or more listeners have the same order, the order that those listeners will be notified is undefined.

        Specified by:
        getArrangeableListenerOrder in interface ArrangeableProxyListener
        Returns:
        an int with the value of the order that this listener should be notified about

      • onHandshakeResponse

        public boolean onHandshakeResponse(HttpMessage httpMessage,
                          Socket inSocket,
                          ZapGetMethod method)
        Description copied from interface: PersistentConnectionListener
        Allows to keep the connection open and perform advanced operations on the Socket. Consider WebSocket connections or Server-Sent Events.
        Specified by:
        onHandshakeResponse in interface PersistentConnectionListener
        Parameters:
        httpMessage - Contains request and response.
        inSocket - Contains TCP connection to browser.
        method - May contain TCP connection to server.
        Returns:
        True if connection is took over, false if not interested.

      • addWebSocketsChannel

        public void addWebSocketsChannel(HttpMessage handshakeMessage,
                        Socket localSocket,
                        Socket remoteSocket,
                        InputStream remoteReader)
        Add an open channel to this extension after HTTP handshake has been completed.
        Parameters:
        handshakeMessage - HTTP-based handshake.
        localSocket - Current connection channel from the browser to ZAP.
        remoteSocket - Current connection channel from ZAP to the server.
        remoteReader - Current InputStream of remote connection.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(HistoryReference handshakeRef)
        Returns true if the WebSocket connection that followed the given WebSocket handshake is already alive.
        Parameters:
        handshakeRef -
        Returns:
        True if connection is still alive.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(Integer channelId)

        Parameters:
        channelId -
        Returns:
        True if connection is still alive.

      • setChannelIgnoreList

        public void setChannelIgnoreList(List<String> ignoreList)
                          throws WebSocketException
        Submitted list of strings will be interpreted as regular expression on WebSocket channel URLs.

        While connections to those excluded URLs will be established and messages will be forwarded, nothing is stored nor can you view the communication in the UI.

        Parameters:
        ignoreList -
        Throws:
        WebSocketException

      • getChannelIgnoreList

        public List<String> getChannelIgnoreList()

      • isChannelIgnored

        public boolean isChannelIgnored(WebSocketChannelDTO channel)
        If given channel is blacklisted, then nothing should be stored. Moreover it should not appear in user interface, but messages should be forwarded.
        Parameters:
        wsProxy -
        Returns:

      • sessionChanged

        public void sessionChanged(Session session)
        Description copied from interface: SessionChangedListener
        Called just after the session has changed. sessionChanged may be called by non-event thread. Should handle with care in all the listener. Use EventThread for each GUI event.
        Specified by:
        sessionChanged in interface SessionChangedListener

      • sessionAboutToChange

        public void sessionAboutToChange(Session session)
        Description copied from interface: SessionChangedListener
        Called just prior to the session changing. Listeners should close down any resources associaited with this session. sessionAboutToChange may be called by non-event thread. Should handle with care in all the listener. Use EventThread for each GUI event.
        Specified by:
        sessionAboutToChange in interface SessionChangedListener

      • sessionScopeChanged

        public void sessionScopeChanged(Session session)
        Description copied from interface: SessionChangedListener
        Called when the user has changes the session scope. sessionScopeChanged may be called by non-event thread. Should handle with care in all the listener. Use EventThread for each GUI event.
        Specified by:
        sessionScopeChanged in interface SessionChangedListener

      • sessionModeChanged

        public void sessionModeChanged(Control.Mode mode)
        Description copied from interface: SessionChangedListener

        Specified by:
        sessionModeChanged in interface SessionChangedListener

      • isSafe

        public boolean isSafe(WebSocketMessageDTO message)
        Returns false when either in Control.Mode.safe or in Control.Mode.protect and the message's channel is not in scope. Call it if you want to do "unsafe" actions like changing payloads, catch breakpoints, send custom messages, etc.
        Parameters:
        message -
        Returns:
        True if operation on message is not potentially dangerous.
